hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification with Volatility Compression
hypothesis_content.statement: Following a period of low volatility (BTC 20-day realized vol < 40%) and a neutral-to-bullish regime, a positive CPI surprise (actual < consensus by ≥0.2%) will trigger a 2-hour momentum surge in BTC that exceeds the initial 15-minute move by a factor of 1.5x, as institutional flows amplify the initial retail reaction.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Low volatility environments create pent-up directional pressure. Positive macro catalysts (disinflation) trigger outsized moves as systematic strategies (vol targeting, risk parity) and institutional re-risking amplify the initial move. The 15-minute filter avoids false breakouts from headline reactions.
entry_conditions: Pre-catalyst: BTC 20-day realized volatility < 40% for 3 consecutive days
Catalyst trigger: US CPI print (actual < consensus by ≥0.2%)
Entry: Market buy BTC 15 minutes after CPI release if price > open + 1.5%

exit_conditions.take_profit: Close position after 2 hours OR at +3.5% from entry
exit_conditions.time_exit: 2 hours post-entry if neither TP nor SL hit

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Median 2-hour return after positive CPI surprise (≥0.2% beat) is ≤1.2x the initial 15-minute move in low-vol environments.
